items.sentence: Tom fasted for three days, only drinking water.
Tom doesn't want to be the next one to do that.
Tom doesn't want to be a professional musician.
Tom doesn't think it'll be possible to do that.
Tom doesn't think Mary ought to have done that.
Tom doesn't mind eating after the children eat.
Tom doesn't believe you really want to do that.
I don't want to think about homework right now.
The invitation said that I could bring a guest.
I hope that you and your wife have a nice trip.
I want you to understand how important this is.
The sign in the park read "Keep off the grass."
Tom promised not to spend any more money today.
Tom asked Mary if she could play the accordion.
Here's a list of reasons why I'd never buy one.
You can't buy anything like this anywhere else.
If the people don't like it, they won't buy it.
If you don't like apricots, buy something else.
You shouldn't have to worry about that anymore.
Tom is sure Mary knows that she has to do that.
